OpenAnafi’s Documentation¶

Models¶

Documentation on the two data models : Open_anafi and the dynamic database requester

OpenAnafi¶

class open_anafi.models.Department(*args, **kwargs)[source]¶

Bases: django.db.models.base.Model

The list of all the french departments

Parameters

  • name (str) – The department’s name

  • number (str) – The identifier of the department. Stored as a string because one of them contains a letter

exception DoesNotExist¶

Bases: django.core.exceptions.ObjectDoesNotExist

exception MultipleObjectsReturned¶

Bases: django.core.exceptions.MultipleObjectsReturned

class open_anafi.models.Frame(*args, **kwargs)[source]¶

Bases: django.db.models.base.Model

A frame contains multiple indicators, as well as an output file, and is used to generate reports.

Parameters

  • name (str) – The name of the frame

  • indicators (list, class:open_anafi.models.Indicator, optional) – The indicators linked to the frame

  • identifiers_type (list, class:open_anafi.models.IdentifierType) – The types of identifiers that the frame can be calculated on

  • insitutions_type – The institutions the frame can be calculated on

  • model_name (str) – The name of the excel file the frame outputs to

  • description (str, optional) – The description of the frame

  • max_depth (int) – The maximum depth among all the indicators linked to the frame

  • reports (list, class:open_anafi.models.Reports, optional) – The list of reports generated by this frame

exception DoesNotExist¶

Bases: django.core.exceptions.ObjectDoesNotExist

exception MultipleObjectsReturned¶

Bases: django.core.exceptions.MultipleObjectsReturned

name (str) – The name of the identifier type

class open_anafi.models.Indicator(*args, **kwargs)[source]¶

Bases: django.db.models.base.Model

This Table represents an indicator, who can store multiple parameters based on years / budgets, and can be linked to multiple frames.

Parameters

  • name (str) – The name of the indicator

  • description (str) – The description of the indicator

  • max_depth (int) – The maximum depth among all the parameters

  • public (bool) – Indicates if the indicator is visible to other users

  • last_modified_by (class:django.contrib.auth.models.User) – The user who last modified this indicator

  • frames (list, class:open_anafi.models.Frame, optional) – The frames the indicator is associated to

  • parameters (list, class:open_anafi.models.IndicatorParameter, optional) – The parameters linked to this indicator

  • libelles (list, class:open_anafi.models.IndicatorLibelle, optional) – The list of libelles linked to an indicator:

An indicator can have multiple aliases, for better understanding of its purpose

class open_anafi.models.IndicatorParameter(*args, **kwargs)[source]¶

Bases: django.db.models.base.Model

An indicator parameter, containing a formula. It is linked to a single indicator.

Parameters

  • indicator (class:open_anafi.model.Indicator) – The indicator this parameter belongs to

  • year_min (int) – The minimum year for this parameter to apply

  • year_max (int) – The maximum year for thisparameter to apply

  • readable_equation (tuple) – The equation in a python readable way based on tuples

  • displaying (str) – Stores parameters related to calculating this parameter. For example, absolute value

  • institution_type_number (int) – The identifier of the institution this parameter is valid on

  • institution_type_string (str) – The label of the institution this parameter is valid on

  • type_budget (str) – Specifies the way we calculate the indicator

  • original_equation (str) – The original equation for this parameter, in a human readable way

  • depth (int) – How many indicators have to be calculated before this one can

exception DoesNotExist¶

Bases: django.core.exceptions.ObjectDoesNotExist

exception MultipleObjectsReturned¶

Bases: django.core.exceptions.MultipleObjectsReturned

class open_anafi.models.InstitutionType(*args, **kwargs)[source]¶

Bases: django.db.models.base.Model

Represents a type of institution (Commune, EPHAD etc)

Parameters

  • name (str) – The name of this institution type

  • number (int) – The identifier used to represent this institution type (different from the primary key in the database)

  • legal_status (int) – Number representing the legal status

class open_anafi.models.Report(*args, **kwargs)[source]¶

Bases: django.db.models.base.Model

All the reports generated

Parameters

  • frame (class:open_anafi.models.Frame) – The frame used to generate the report

  • year_min (int) – The lower bound of the range to calculate the report on

  • year_max (int) – The upper bound of the range to calculate the report on

  • identifier (str) – The identifier to generate the report on (can be a concat of multiple identifiers)

  • identifier_type (str) – The type of the identifier

  • state (str) – Arbitrary string to indicate the state of the report. (En cours, Terminé, En échec)

  • name (str) – The name of the produced excel file

  • date (date) – The creation date of the report

  • user (class:django.contrib.auth.models.User) – The user who created the report

class open_anafi.models.Variable(*args, **kwargs)[source]¶

Bases: django.db.models.base.Model

A variable used inside of formulas. Represents a line of a compte

Parameters

  • name (str) – The full name of the variable (a concatenation of all the information to calculate it)

  • indicator_parameter (class:open_anafi.models.IndicatorParameter) – The indicator parameter the variable is linked to

  • numero_compte (str) – The identifier of the compte to extract the values from

  • type_solde (str) – The type of operation (debit, crédit)

  • solde (str) – The solde of the account, stored in as a string to ensure proper decimal values

exception DoesNotExist¶

Bases: django.core.exceptions.ObjectDoesNotExist

exception MultipleObjectsReturned¶

Bases: django.core.exceptions.MultipleObjectsReturned

Requester¶

class database.models.Alias(*args, **kwargs)[source]¶

Bases: django.db.models.base.Model

An alias is attached to a column, and can have predefined parameters in a select (substring, sum etc).

Parameters

  • alias (str) – The label of the alias

  • folder (str) – This can be used in a frontend to organize the aliases in sections.

  • column (class:database.models.Column) – The column this alias is linked to

  • option (str) – An option that will be applied when selecting this alias in a request (substring, sum, concat etc)

  • selects (list of class:database.models.Select) – All the selections that use this alias

  • conditions (list of class:database.models.Condition) – All the conditions using this alias

exception DoesNotExist¶

Bases: django.core.exceptions.ObjectDoesNotExist

exception MultipleObjectsReturned¶

Bases: django.core.exceptions.MultipleObjectsReturned

class database.models.Column(*args, **kwargs)[source]¶

Bases: django.db.models.base.Model

Represents column

Parameters

  • name (str) – The name of the column

  • data_type (str) – The type of this column registered in the database

  • table (class:database.models.Table) – The table this column belongs to

  • aliases (list of class:database.models.Alias) – The list of all the aliases given to the column

class database.models.Condition(*args, **kwargs)[source]¶

Bases: django.db.models.base.Model

A condition applied to a request

Parameters

  • column (class:database.models.Column) – The column to apply the condition on

  • request (class:database.models.Request) – The request this condition belongs to

  • operator – The operator of the condition (IN, =, <=, < etc)

  • data (str) – The condition’s data (ex: IN (values) or = x)

Bases: django.db.models.base.Model

class database.models.Request(*args, **kwargs)[source]¶

Bases: django.db.models.base.Model

A request that can be executed or saved and loaded by a user

Parameters

  • name (str) – The name of the request

  • description (str) – The description of the request

  • user (class:django.contrib.auth.models.User) – The user this request belongs to

  • galaxy (class:database.models.Galaxy) – The galaxy this requst belongs to

  • conditions_edit (str) – A shortened version of the condition string in the form : condition_id AND/OR condition_id etc…

Controllers¶

The IndicatorTools class¶

class open_anafi.lib.IndicatorTools[source]¶

Bases: object

static calculateMaxDepth(indicator)[source]¶

Calculates the depth of an indicator (the max depth of all its parameters)

Parameters

indicator (class:open_anafi.models.Indicator) – The indicator to evaluate

static updateDepth(indicator)[source]¶
Updates the depth of an indicator after an update.

Recursively updates all the affected indicators/frames

Parameters

indicator (class:open_anafi.models.Indicator) – The indicator to evaluate

static updateIndicator(equation, description, id, username)[source]¶

Update an indicator. This method will destory it and recreate it restoring all the previous parameters. It will also update the depth recursively.

Note that we cannot modify the indicator’s name.

Parameters

  • equation (str) – The updated equation (updated or not)

  • description (str) – The updated description

  • id (int) – The indicator’s id

  • username (str) – The username of the user who modified the indicator

Returns

The updated indicator

Return type

class:open_anafi.models.Indicator

The VariableTools class¶

class open_anafi.lib.VariableTools[source]¶

Bases: object

static feed_variable(variable, exges_list, exges_effective, data_frame_comptes)[source]¶

Evaluates a variable with the given data.

Parameters

  • variable (class:open_anafi.models.Variable) – The variable object

  • exges_list (dict) – The range of exercices given by the user

  • exges_effective (dict) – The effective range of exercices (without the empty ones)

  • data_frame_comptes (class:pandas.DataFrame) – The account data

Returns

A numpy array with the variable evaluation for each year (zero for empty exercices)

Return type

class:numpy.Array

static calculateDepth(frame)[source]¶

Evaluate the depth of a frame (the maximum depth among all its children)

Parameters

frame (class:open_anafi.models.Frame) – The frame to evaluate

The Parsing tools¶

open_anafi.lib.parsing_tools.calculateDepth(indicator_parameter, parameters_to_calculate, all_indicators)[source]¶

A temporary recursive function that evaluates the depth of a list of indicators in an unorganized excel file

Parameters

  • indicator_parameter (class:open_anafi.models.IndicatorParameter) – The current indicator parameter to evaluate

  • parameters_to_calculate (dict) – The list of remaining indicator parameters to evaluate

  • all_indicators (dict) – All the indicators present in the excel file

open_anafi.lib.parsing_tools.createParameter(parsedParameter, formule, indicator, **kwargs)[source]¶

Creates an indicator parameter. Can be used while parsing an excel file containing multiple indicators. In this case the ‘parameters_to_calculate’ parameter has to be sent

Parameters

  • parsedParameter (tuple) – The tuple corresponding to a single parameter, parsed by the langage analyzer

  • formule (str) – The original equation (as a string typed by the user)

  • indicator (class:open_anafi.models.Indicator) – The indicator to link the parameter to

  • all_indicators (optional dict) – A dictionnary of all the indicators present in the excel file (This parameter is used to determine if we are working on one or multiple indicators)

  • parameters_to_calculate (optional dict) – A dictionnary of all the indicator parameters whose depth cannot be calculated right now (depth > 1)

Returns

The created indicator parameter

Return type

class:open_anafi.models.IndicatorParameter

open_anafi.lib.parsing_tools.createVariable(variable, indicator_parameter)[source]¶

Create an open_anafi variable object linked to an indicator parameter

Parameters

  • variable (class:open_anafi.lib.ply.parsing_classes.Var) – The variable to create

  • indicator_parameter (class:ope_anafi.models.IndicatorParameter) – The indicator parameter to link the variable to

open_anafi.lib.parsing_tools.extractIndicatorsAndVariables(tree, indicators, indicator_parameter)[source]¶

Recursive function that will create the Variables and retrieve the indicators from a parsed equation (a tuple)

Parameters

  • tree (tuple, Var, Indic, str, int) – The node to a analyze

  • indicators (list) – The array containing all the indicators present in the equation

  • indicator_parameter (class:open_anafi.models.IndicatorParameter) – The indicator parameter to link the variables to

Returns

A tuple of the equation that can be read by the report parser

Return type

tuple, str, int

open_anafi.lib.parsing_tools.getOrCreateFrame(frame_name, model_name, frame_description, nomenclature, institution_types, identifier_types)[source]¶

Retrieves or create an open_anafi frame.

Parameters

  • frame_name (str) – The name of the frame

  • model_name (str) – The name of the excel file the frame outputs to

  • frame_description (str) – The description of the frame

  • nomenclature (optional int) – The id of the nomenclature to attach the frame to

  • institution_types (list of int) – The institutions the frame can be calculated on

  • identifier_types (list of int) – The types of identifiers that the frame can be calculated on

Returns

The retrieved or created Frame

Return type

class:open_anafi.models.Frame

Apply styles to a range of cells as if they were a single cell.

Parameters

  • ws (class:openpyxl.Worksheet) – Excel worksheet instance

  • range (str) – An excel range to style (e.g. A1:F20)

  • border (class:openpyxl.styles.Border) – An openpyxl Border

static style_range(ws, cell_range, border=<openpyxl.styles.borders.Border object> Parameters: outline=True, diagonalUp=False, diagonalDown=False, start=None, end=None, left=<openpyxl.styles.borders.Side object> Parameters: style=None, color=None, right=<openpyxl.styles.borders.Side object> Parameters: style=None, color=None, top=<openpyxl.styles.borders.Side object> Parameters: style=None, color=None, bottom=<openpyxl.styles.borders.Side object> Parameters: style=None, color=None, diagonal=<openpyxl.styles.borders.Side object> Parameters: style=None, color=None, vertical=None, horizontal=None, fill=None, font=None, alignment=None)[source]¶

Apply styles to a range of cells as if they were a single cell.

Parameters

  • ws (class:openpyxl.Worksheet) – Excel worksheet instance

  • range (str) – An excel range to style (e.g. A1:F20)

  • border (class:openpyxl.styles.Border) – An openpyxl Border

  • fill (class:openpyxl.styles.Fill) – An openpyxl PatternFill or GradientFill

  • font (class:openpyxl.styles.Font) – An openpyxl Font object

static write_balance(identifiers, identifiers_type, year_min, year_max, libsiret, balances)[source]¶

Generate a ‘Balance des comptes’ report, which is a dump of the data in the accounts

Parameters

  • identifiers (str) – The identifier(s) the balance was calculated on (concatenation in case of an aggreggation)

  • identifiers_type (str) – The type of the identifiers (SIRET, SIREN, FINESS)

  • year_min (int) – The lower bound of the range the balance was calculated on

  • year_max (int) – The lower bound of the range the balance was calculated on

  • libsiret (str) – The establishment’s label (#TODO check this, not sure)

  • balances (class:pandas.DataFrame) – The dataframe containing all the infos to write

static write_headers(sheet)[source]¶

Writes the headers for a balance des comptes report.

Parameters

sheet (class:openpyxl.Worksheet) – The excel worksheet to work on

static write_perimeter_headers(sheet)[source]¶

Writes the headers for the perimeter sheet of the report

Parameters

sheet (class:openpyxl.Worksheet) – The excel sheet to work on

static write_report(computed_indicators, ident, type_ident, exmin, exmax, libsiret, model_name, dps=None, aggregate=False)[source]¶

Writes an open_anafi report into an excel file.

Parameters

  • computed_indicators (class:pandas.DataFrame) – A list of all the indicators and their values for each year to evaluate

  • ident (str) – The identifier(s) the report was evaluated on (A concatenation if multiple SIRETS)

  • type_ident (str) – The type of the identifier (SIRET, SIREN, FINESS)

  • exmin (int) – The lower bound of the range the report was calculated on

  • exmax (int) – The lower bound of the range the report was calculated on

  • libsiret (str) – The establishment’s label (#TODO check this, not sure)

  • model_name (str) – The name of the reference excel file (The model to fill)

  • dps (dict) – #TODO Figure out wtf this is

  • aggregate (bool) – If the report was an aggreggation of multiple identifiers or not

Returns

The name of the created Excel file

Return type

str
